comment: Second time taking her and would take her again. Just like any lit class, it's a lot of reading, but the novels are all books you'd want to read anyway, and she also understands about it being a lot and many weeks your only work is to read. Organized, quick to grade, and quality feedback. Final paper has been due in pieces so it's not stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She was an amazing teacher. Had us reading great and interesting books with audio discussions which are honestly a lot easier than written ones. Most of the grades are essays and there was one PowerPoint. She has peer reviews where you get and give feedback. She is accessible outside of class. Definitely read the books and put effort into papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great class content, expectations clear from the beginning. I enjoyed the class, and I had no issues with the instruction.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: dr. brown spiers certainly cares for her students, but can be a very picky grader. her class is almost entirely paper based, with a few discussions and one powerpoint project. if you're good at writing/can write quickly, this class won't take up much of your week. however, be prepared to actually read the material and write above the normal level.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She's very supportive don't get me wrong. Gotta expect numerous assignments and a bunch of reading. When working on those assignments, she's very picky and tends to expect a lot of context from the readings.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: There are no zoom calls at all. You have discussion posts and responses which are super easy but you have quizzes over the ready that are not. The quizzes arent lockdown or webcam but they go into depth about the reading so theyre hard. You have an essay over a book for the final. I havent made a good grade on any of the quizzes, no lectures.
Very kind, and keeps you up to date on real news involving your class topic!

I love Dr. Brown Spiers! I don't understand why other people have had bad experiences. She asks a lot of good questions and tries her best to engage with you. You'll have 3 mandatory reads - and yes, you have to read them in order to pass the class. We had to shut down due to COVID-19, and she was the most understand and easy transition!

Dr. Brown-Spiers is a wonderful professor. I took two of her classes (one was online and the other in-class) this past semester, but with COVID-19 both classes remained online for the semester. I have never known a more caring professor! She will help with anything you need and typically emails back very quickly. You have to work, but she is great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Brown-Spiers is an incredible professor. Even while taking her class online, it is clear even through the internet that she truly cares about her students and loves being a teacher. I took her the first semester she was teaching Studies in American Identities and thoroughly enjoyed her class. She is so intelligent and wants you to succeed!

This was honestly one of the worst professors Ive ever had in my life. Her grading is so unclear Its ridiculous. This was supposed to be an easy gen ed but turned out to be one of my hardest classes with 3 required books that you dont even read all of. If you dont conform to her opinion then she gives you a weird look and its very uncomfortable
Reading quizzes every class for assigned readings. VERY tough grader but gives pretty clear criteria. Participation is expected each class with reading discussions. Very bland lectures.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: the lectures are sometimes very long and usually quite heavy and sometimes boring. textbook is neccessary. she's nice and very accessible outside of class.
